item.title: Audrey add a quote by W.S. Gilbert
item.description: "To sit in solemn silence on a dull, dark dock in a pestilential prison with a life-long lock awaiting the sensation of a short, sharp shock from a cheap and chippy chopper on a big, black block." -- W.S. Gilbert

item.title: Audrey add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "When the horrors of anarchy force us to set up laws that forbid us to fight and torture one another for sport, we still snatch at every excuse for declaring individuals outside the protection of law and torturing them to our hearts content." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Audrey add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Patriotism is, fundamentally, a conviction that a particular country is the best in the world because you were born in it...." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Audrey add a quote by Milne A. A.
item.description:
"The third-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking with the majority. The second-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking with the minority. The first-rate mind is only happy when it is thinking."
[<i>War With Honour</i>, 1940]" -- Milne A. A.

item.title: Audrey add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "The fundamental cause of the trouble is that in the modern world the stupid are cocksure while the intelligent are full of doubt." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Audrey add a quote by Dom Helder Camara
item.description: "When I give food to the poor, they call me a saint. When I ask why the poor have no food, they call me a communist." -- Dom Helder Camara

item.title: Audrey add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "In all affairs it's a healthy thing now and then to hang a question mark on the things you have long taken for granted." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Audrey add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "It is, in fact, nothing short of a miracle that the modern methods of instruction have not yet entirely strangled the holy curiosity of inquiry; for this delicate little plant, aside from stimulation, stands mainly in need of freedom. Without this it goes to wrack and ruin without fail." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Audrey add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Common sense is what tells us the earth is flat." -- Albert Einstein
